Basic details: Emily Johnson, a 13-month-old girl, is brought to the ED by her parents due to seizures.
Vitals:
BP: 90/60 mm Hg
Temp: 101.3°F (38.5°C)
RR: 30/minute
HR: 130/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Lie on the bed with intermittent jerking movements of the arms and legs.
Eyes may roll back during the seizure episodes.
Postictal state: appear drowsy and confused after the seizure.
If asked about recent illnesses, mention a recent upper respiratory infection.
Challenging question: "Why is my baby having seizures? Is it something serious?"
